did.abstract: Letter, 1774, from Captain James Scott to Col. John Hancock, reporting the safe arrival of the ship Hayley and commenting on reaction to the Boston Tea Party in London; letter, 1779, from William Lee to John Hancock concerning his movements and his plans for defending New York City and discussing the treatment of Tories in the area. Also receipts for pew rent, postage, bridge tolls, and taxes, some pertaining to Torry Hancock.
